meanings.definition: A building material consisting of a sheet of gypsum plaster sandwiched between two layers of paper.
meanings.sent1: The drywall in our house is white and smooth.
meanings.sent2: Contractors use drywall to build walls in homes.
meanings.sent3: I tried to paint a smiley face on the drywall, but it looked lopsided.
meanings.sent4: The drywall in the room separated us like an invisible barrier.
meanings.sent5: The sound of a hammer hitting drywall echoed through the house.

meanings.definition: To cover or decorate with drywall.
meanings.sent1: We will drywall the entire basement next week.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to drywall by watching online tutorials.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally drywalled the wrong side of the wall first.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to drywall over her heart, protecting it from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The artist drywalled the exhibit hall with colorful panels.
